channel.title: Adding a Teleportation Spell Problem
channel.description: I added a new teleportation spell to spelldef in both the server and client, and also in spellhandler.java. The spell appears, but when I click on it then click on myself, it does nothing. What file do I need to edit that I haven't edited? Thank you

item.title: Adding a Teleportation Spell Problem
item.dc:creator: @rune2h rune2h
item.description:
@rune2h wrote:

Here’s what I added to SpellDef.xml and Spells.rscd:

<SpellDef> <reqLevel>99</reqLevel> <type>0</type> <runeCount>3</runeCount> <requiredRunes> <entry> <int>33</int> <int>30</int> </entry> <entry> <int>42</int> <int>10</int> </entry> <entry> <int>31</int> <int>10</int> </entry> </requiredRunes> <exp>700</exp> <name>Fight Arena teleport</name> <description>Teleports you to the King Black Dragon</description> </SpellDef>

Here’s what I added to SpellHandler.java:

case 49: // Fight Arena player.teleport(615, 700, true); break;

I didn’t change anything else besides adding the codes above. I have never changed spells before. I don’t see why it won’t work. Thank you so much for helping me.

What happens when I try to use the spell is that I click on the spell then click on myself and nothing happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding a Teleportation Spell Problem
item.dc:creator: @rune2h rune2h
item.description:
@rune2h wrote:

I’ll post in the right forums next time. Here’s the code

private void handleTeleport(Player player, SpellDef spell, int id) {
  		if(player.inCombat()) {
  			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cannot teleport while in combat.");
  			return;
  		}
	if(player.getLocation().wildernessLevel() >= 20 || (player.getLocation().inModRoom() && !player.isMod())) {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting.");
		return;
	}
	if(!checkAndRemoveRunes(player, spell)) {
		return;
	}
	switch(id) {
		case 12: // Varrock
			player.teleport(615, 700, true);
			break;
		case 15: // Lumbridge
			player.teleport(118, 649, true);
			break;
		case 18: // Falador
			player.teleport(313, 550, true);
			break;
		case 22: // Camalot
			player.teleport(465, 456, true);
			break;
		case 26: // Ardougne
			player.teleport(585, 621, true);
			break;
		case 31: // Watchtower
			player.teleport(637, 2628, true);
			break;
		case 37: // Lost city
			player.teleport(131, 3544, true);
			break;
		case 49: // Fight Arena
			player.teleport(615, 700, true);
			break;
	}
	finalizeSpell(player, spell);

I changed the varrock teleport coordinates to the fight arena just to test if it would work, and it did… That really makes me wonder why the fight arena teleport won’t work.

Read full topic
